cellularAutomata.rules.templates
Class MultiGenerationIntegerRuleTemplate

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.rules.RuleActions
      cellularAutomata.rules.Rule
          cellularAutomata.rules.IntegerRule
              cellularAutomata.rules.templates.MultiGenerationIntegerRuleTemplate
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
MultiGenerationBinaryRuleTemplate
public abstract class MultiGenerationIntegerRuleTemplate
extends IntegerRule

A convenience class/template for all rules that behave as an integer function of their neighbors, both at the current time step and for an arbitrary number of previous time steps. This class handles conversion of the neighbors as Cells to neighbors as integer values so that the subclass only has to worry about specifying the integer function. This conversion makes sure that the cells all return their state values for the same generation as the current cell.
This class uses the cell state cellularAutomaton.cellState.model.IntegerCellState.
The number of integer states is set on the GUI and defaults to 2. Neither this class nor its children can change that value directly.

This class uses the Template Method design pattern. Subclasses implement the abstract integerRule() method which is called by the template method calculateNewState().

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

MultiGenerationIntegerRuleTemplate

public MultiGenerationIntegerRuleTemplate(boolean minimalOrLazyInitialization)
Create a rule using the given cellular automaton properties.

When building child classes, the minimalOrLazyInitialization parameter must be included but may be ignored. However, the boolean is intended to indicate when the child's constructor should build a rule with as small a footprint as possible. In order to load rules by reflection, the application must query the child classes for information like their display names, tooltip descriptions, etc. At these times it makes no sense to build the complete rule which may have a large footprint in memory.

It is recommended that the child's constructor and instance variables do not initialize any variables and that variables be initialized only when first needed (lazy initialization). Or all initializations in the constructor may be placed in an if statement. 

 if(!minimalOrLazyInitialization)
 {
     ...initialize
 }

Parameters:
minimalOrLazyInitialization - When true, the constructor instantiates an object with as small a footprint as possible. When false, the rule is fully constructed. If uncertain, set this variable to false.
Method Detail

calculateNewState

public final CellState calculateNewState(Cell cell,
                                         Cell[] neighbors)
Calculates a new state for the cell by finding values for it and its neighbors at the current and at previous generations. The number of previous generations is specified by the method getRequiredNumberOfGenerations(). The abstract integer function is then called to calculate a new state. By convention the neighbors should be indexed clockwise starting to the northwest of the cell.

Specified by:
calculateNewState in class Rule
Parameters:
cell - The cell being updated.
neighbors - The cells on which the update is based (usually neighboring cells). By convention the neighbors should be indexed clockwise starting to the northwest of the cell. May be null if want this method to find the "neighboring" cells.
Returns:
A new state for the cell.

getCompatibleCellState

public final CellState getCompatibleCellState()
Gets an instance of the CellState class that is compatible with this rule (must be the same as the type returned by the method calculateNewState()). The values assigned to this instance are unimportant because it will only be used to construct instances of this class type using reflection. Appropriate cellStates to return include HexagonalBinaryCellState and SquareBinaryCellState.

Specified by:
getCompatibleCellState in class Rule
Returns:
An instance of the CellState (its state values are unimportant).

getCompatibleCellStateView

public CellStateView getCompatibleCellStateView()
Gets an instance of the CellStateView class that will be used to display cells being updated by this rule. Note: This method must return a view that is able to display cell states of the type returned by the method getCompatibleCellState(). Appropriate CellStatesViews to return include BinaryCellStateView, IntegerCellStateView, HexagonalIntegerCellStateView, IntegerVectorArrowView, IntegerVectorDefaultView, and RealValuedDefaultView among others. the user may also create their own views (see online documentation).

Any values passed to the constructor of the CellStateView should match those values needed by this rule.

Specified by:
getCompatibleCellStateView in class Rule
Returns:
An instance of the CellStateView (any values passed to the constructor of the CellStateView should match those values needed by this rule).

getCompatibleLattices

public java.lang.String[] getCompatibleLattices()
A list of lattices with which this Rule will work; in this case, returns all lattices by default, though child classes may wish to override this and restrict the lattices with which the child rule will work.

Well-designed Rules should work with any lattice, but some may require particular topological or geometrical information (like the lattice gas). Appropriate strings to return in the array include SquareLattice.DISPLAY_NAME, HexagonalLattice.DISPLAY_NAME, StandardOneDimensionalLattice.DISPLAY_NAME, etc. If null, will be compatible with all lattices.

Specified by:
getCompatibleLattices in class Rule
Returns:
A list of lattices compatible with this Rule (returns the display names for the lattices). Returns null if compatible with all lattices.
